contents.title: Frequently Asked Questions

items.title: Galaxy S24 Ultra vs Galaxy S23 Ultra - what's different?
items.description:
An upgraded processor drives Galaxy S24 Ultra with NPU performance improved by 41%, GPU by 30% and CPU by 20% compared to Galaxy S23 Ultra. Its Vapour Chamber is 92% larger than its predecessor for improved heat dissipation. At 2600 nits, Galaxy S24 Ultra has the brightest adaptive display on a Galaxy yet. Plus, with CorningÂ® GorillaÂ® Armor, the screen is less reflective than Galaxy S23 Ultra. Finally, Galaxy S24 Ultra has a 200MP Wide-angle Camera with ProVisual engine for AI enhancement, which is the first application on a Galaxy smartphone.

Learn more about the key differences between the Galaxy S24 and Galaxy S23 in our helpful article.

items.title: How good is the Galaxy S24 Ultra camera?
items.description:
The Galaxy S24 Ultra's camera is head and shoulders above the rest. It is the first ever Galaxy smartphone to come equipped with the Quad Tele system, allowingyou to take clearer and crisper photos in the optical zoom range.

Learn more about the epic Galaxy S24 Ultra camera features in our helpful article.

items.title: How big is the Galaxy S24 Ultra screen size compared to Galaxy S24+?
items.description:
The Galaxy S24 Ultra has a 6.8-inch screen size, which is 0.6 inches larger than Galaxy S24 at 6.2 inches and 0.1 inches larger than the Galaxy S24+ at 6.7inches.

Find the best Galaxy S24 phone for you in this helpful guide.

items.title: How long does the battery last on Galaxy S24 Ultra?
items.description: The Galaxy S24 Ultra battery lasts up to 30 hours and can play music for up to 95 hours, thanks to the 5,000mAh (typical) battery power.

contents.title: Armor up with titanium
contents.description: Check out the upgrade â€” a durable shield of titanium built right into the frame. The strength of titanium is now at your fingertips.
contents.imageAlt: A close up of the Galaxy S24 Ultra display at a slight angle showing the sides.

items.title: Better scratch resistance with CorningÂ® GorillaÂ® Armor
items.description: CorningÂ® GorillaÂ® Armor helps protect your screen from scratches to keep your device looking beautiful.
items.imageAlt: A transparent layer representing CorningÂ® GorillaÂ® Armor hovers over Galaxy S24 Ultra.

items.title: Water and dust resistant. Worry free
items.description: Don't let water dampen your spirits. Galaxy S24 Ultra is IP68 water and dust resistant â€” so you're ready for every adventure, puddles and all.
items.imageAlt: Water splashes against Galaxy S24 Ultra.

contents.title:
Find the sleep
symbol that
matches your
sleep type

tabs.title: Unconcerned lion
tabs.description: Lions are relaxed and have healthy sleep patterns.

tabs.title: Sensitive hedgehog
tabs.description: Hedgehogs are watchful and active at night.

tabs.title: Nervous penguin
tabs.description: Penguins are nervous and only sleep sporadically for 3.5 hours a day.

tabs.title: Sun-adverse mole
tabs.description: Moles are nocturnal and sleep about 8 hours during the day.

tabs.title: Cautious deer
tabs.description: Deer remain alert, sleeping less than 10 minutes at a time, so they can run away when they're in danger.

tabs.title: Easygoing walrus
tabs.description: Walruses can stay awake for 84 hours and sleep for up to 19 hours.

tabs.title: Alligator on the hunt
tabs.description: Alligators are nocturnal and can sleep with one eye open as if they're winking.

tabs.title: Exhausted shark
tabs.description: Sharks rarely sleep because they need to stay awake to breathe.

contents.title: BLOOD OXYGEN
contents.headline: Measure blood<br class='interactive-br__pc' /> oxygen levels<br class='interactive-br__pc' /> from your wrist
contents.description: Built-in blood oxygen measurement on Galaxy Watch4 lets you check the amounts of oxygen in your bloodstream at any time. Oxygen saturation is directly linked to physical performance, so monitoring your blood oxygen can help you maintain your health.
contents.imageAlt: Black Galaxy Watch4 displays oxygen saturation and BPM measurements.

contents.title: BLOOD PRESSURE & ECG
contents.headline: All the data your heart desires
contents.description: Meet the Samsung BioActive Sensor that measures ECG and blood pressure in real time. After initial calibration, the sensors quickly check your blood pressure. You can also check abnormal heart rate and rhythm through ECG and send data straight to your phone to be easily shared.

items.title: Contrary to popular belief
items.description: Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Richard McClintock, a Latin professor at Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia, looked up one of the more obscure Latin words, consectetur, from a Lorem Ipsum passage, and going through the cites of the word in classical literature, discovered the undoubtable source. Lorem Ipsum comes from sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 of 'de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum' (The Extremes of Good and Evil) by Cicero, written in 45 BC. This book is a treatise on the theory of ethics, very popular during the Renaissance. The first line of Lorem Ipsum, 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet..', comes from a line in section 1.10.32. The standard chunk of Lorem Ipsum used since the 1500s is reproduced below for those interested. Sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 from 'de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum' by Cicero are also reproduced in their exact original form, accompanied by English versions from the 1914 translation by H. Rackham.

items.title: Contrary to popular belief
items.description: On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains
